result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Drew Marcello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Drew Marcello is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Drew Marcello was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Joshua Drew Marcello was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 23, 2017 by 2:00 p.m.
Court notes 4 days credit if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 3

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF163.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF163.

-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: advising of DE's current outstanding bal to be pd within 30 days or the debt will be turned over to SDC. Includes 15CF163, 17CF277. jaf
Case reviewed. Bal due in full. jaf

DE called stating he is closing on his house tomrw & needs a letter w/the outstanding balances listed so he can have them added into his loan. Clerk inquired if he needed a specific letter/form or if a simple letter on letterhead was sufficient. DE was also advised he could pick it up at our counter, but would need to pay a copy fee. DE stated he would contact his loan officer to clarify then call back. Includes 15CF163, 17CF277. jaf

DE called back & stated he needs a letter on letterhead w/how much is due and where to pay. DE was advised I can have that ready for him by 10 am tomrw, he can pick it up @ the couner, & he will need to pay $1.25 for the copy fee. jaf

DE called re: pymt due on his 20TR case. DE was advised that he has an unpd bal on this case & is set to be turned over to Coll anytime now. DE inquired about the balances due stating he pd DOC in full to get early release from Probation. DE was advised that I would get a printout from what's been pd to DOC & call him back. DE also advised that I will not turn these over to Coll until after his bal is confirmed & he's given the choice to set up a Pymt Plan here. Includes 15CF163, 17CF277. jaf

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Joshua Drew Marcello appeared. Case called at 11:28 a.m. Court notes 15CF163 is set for a motion to revoke diversion agreement and 17CF277 is set for a plea hearing. Atty Smestad states 17CF277, DE is not ready to plea. Will be taking care of 15CF163. DE does not contest the motion to revoke diversion agreement. Does not admit guilt. Court will enter judgment on original charges. ADA Kelly gives sentencing arguments. Atty Smestad gives sentencing arguments. Court will adopt the joint recommendation. 20 days to file appeal. 17CF277 to be scheduled with Branch 1.

Court orders:

Count 2:

-   S/W 1 year probation. Run concurrent to Ct. 3. Report to probation by 2 p.m. today. 4 days jail credit if revoked.

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   Court costs of $243.00. To be paid over the course of probation

-   DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00

-   AODA and follow through

-    Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

-   20 hours community service hours minus what already has been completed over the course of the diversion agreement

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF163, 15TR1421 and 15TR1422:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Joshua Drew Marcello appeared. Case called at 8:54 a.m. Court received an amended information. ADA Minser recites agreement.    Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct's 2 and 3 in 15CF163. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct's 2 & 3 in 15CF163 and will withhold entry of conviction per the 18 month diversion agreement. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CF163 and 15TR1421 and 15TR1422. Court will sign the diversion program on today's date.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Joshua Drew Marcello appeared. Case called at 9:16 a.m. ADA Minser requesting court to deny the motion requesting since an evidentiary hearing was not held. Atty Kucinski gives argument. Contesting the stop and search. Court will note the state's objection. Will continue with the motion hearing today. State calls Srgt. Volz to the stand. S/T Mark Volz. Employed with the North Hudson P.D. Direct by ADA Minser. Cross by Atty Kucinski. Redirect by ADA Minser. Witness excused. Atty Kucinski calls Joshua Marcello to the stand. S/T Joshua Marcello. Direct by Atty Kucinski. Cross by ADA Minser. Witness excused. Atty Kucinski gives argument. ADA Minser gives argument. Court finds reasonable suspicion for the stop. As for the search, court will deny the defenses motion to suppress. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 11:45 am.
